dt: {bc}being, containing, or relating to one or more mathematical {d_link|integers|integer}
{bc}relating to or concerned with mathematical {d_link|integration|integration} or the results of mathematical integration
{bc}formed as a unit with another part

quotes.t: Sitting out on the grass … watching the freight trains roll by on the levee at two in the morning, drinking a beer and listening to the music drifting out of the club, is an {qword}integral{/qword} part of the whole experience.

Stuffed with peanut butter, celery is the quintessential after-school snack; diced, it provides an essential crunch to chicken and potato salads; buttered up, it is an {qword}integral{/qword} part of Thanksgiving stuffing.

I do know that shoot-'em-ups (and saw-'em-ups) are likely to remain part of our lives, and that suggests a depressing idea: Maybe the love of violence is an {qword}integral{/qword} part of human nature …

shortdef: being, containing, or relating to one or more mathematical integers
relating to or concerned with mathematical integration or the results of mathematical integration

dt: {bc}the result of a mathematical {d_link|integration|integration} {dx}compare {dxt|definite integral||}, {dxt|indefinite integral||}{/dx}

quotes.t: The main tools used in the study of these functions are those we have already discussed: representation as {qword}integrals{/qword}, power-series expansions, and differential equations.

shortdef: the result of a mathematical integration

dt: {bc}a branch of mathematics concerned with the theory and applications (as in the determination of lengths, areas, and volumes and in the solution of differential equations) of integrals and integration

shortdef: a branch of mathematics concerned with the theory and applications (as in the determination of lengths, areas, and volumes and in the solution of differential equations) of integrals and integration

dt: {bc}a mathematical ring in which multiplication is commutative, which has a multiplicative identity element, and which contains no pair of nonzero elements whose product is zero

dt.t: the integers under the operations of addition and multiplication form an {it}integral domain{/it}

shortdef: a mathematical ring in which multiplication is commutative, which has a multiplicative identity element, and which contains no pair of nonzero elements whose product is zero

dt: {bc}the difference between the values of the integral of a given function {it}f{/it}({it}x{/it}) for an upper value {it}b{/it} and a lower value {it}a{/it} of the independent variable {it}x{/it}

shortdef: the difference between the values of the integral of a given function f(x) for an upper value b and a lower value a of the independent variable x

dt: {bc}a definite integral whose region of integration is unbounded or includes a point at which the integrand is undefined or tends to infinity

shortdef: a definite integral whose region of integration is unbounded or includes a point at which the integrand is undefined or tends to infinity

dt: {bc}any function whose derivative is a given function

shortdef: any function whose derivative is a given function

dt: {bc}a definite integral defined as the limit of sums found by partitioning the interval comprising the domain of definition into subintervals, by finding the sum of products each of which consists of the width of a subinterval multiplied by the value of the function at some point in it, and by letting the maximum width of the subintervals approach zero

shortdef: a definite integral defined as the limit of sums found by partitioning the interval comprising the domain of definition into subintervals, by finding the sum of products each of which consists of the width of a subinterval multiplied by the value of the function at some point in it, and by letting the maximum width of the subintervals approach zero
